title: What is the world record for the heaviest object ever lifted by a man? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dear Chily: From your Quora profile, I noticed you are an Extraterrestrial from Alpha Draconi, studying the human race needing to know the physical strength attributes of our race as humans. Here is the strongest man currently holds what we call Gold Medal Championship in the games of Olympic Weightlifting.   Meet Mr. Lasha Talakhadze is a Georgian weightlifter competing in the +105 kg category. Wikipedia This fellow can snatch (one quick movement) 220 kilo, a measurement we use for weights on earth. He can also Clean and jerk (two moves ) 258 kilo, combined total of 477 kilo.  The next guy, Behad Slimi (Behdad Salimi - Wikipedia) is merely a few kilos behind.  Oh, there is another fellow human capable of lifting 1100-pound off the ground and that is about 500 kilo. the weight lifts from the floor to a standing position, named deadlift!. Some of our earth females are also amazingly strong and powerful. Meet Lidia Valentín Pérez is a Spanish weightlifter (Planet Earth) competing mainly in the Women's 75 kg category. Lidia has won three Olympic Medals, a World Weightlifting Championship, as well as four European Weightlifting Championships. Wikipedia   There are many more examples. Search the Google. Thank you

EDIT: This question has been merged and past people have said the same information, so this is nothing that hasn’t already been stated. That would be 6,720lbs by a legend named Paul Anderson, and the lift is the back lift.  The man himself. Note, this is not the back lift. The back lift is depicted below:  This is not Paul, this is just a picture I took from Google. Paul has many other feats of strength that are absolutely nuts, read up on him, you won’t be disappointed!
